candidates.name: Bernard Westerbaan
candidates.why_elect: I am a family man living in the District for 39 Years, married 45 years, five children and eight grandchildren. I am involved in the community: Commsafe patrols, fifth term BOT intermediate school, treasurer local GreyPower, Menzshed, six years community board, able to speed read and understand large reports.
candidates.why_stand: This election is for the people of Waipa (Te Awamutu Ward). I am a people's person and promote a Triple A rating being accountable, approachable and being an advocate for residents. I believe in honesty and timely feedback. Not scared to ask the difficult question. I'm sometimes called persistent.

candidates.name: John Wood
candidates.why_elect: I have been involved in the district for over 35 years and would bring a unique mix of skills and experience to council.
candidates.why_stand: I want to champion a practical approach to our evolving community.

candidates.name: Andrew Brown
candidates.why_elect: Apart from nine years studying and working in Wellington, my home has been in Waipa. I grew up here, practiced as an accountant here and own a business here. My knowledge of this community and skill-set make me a good candidate for Waipa District Council.
candidates.why_stand: Waipa is a great place to live. Past councils and council staff have made good decisions meaning Waipa is in a great position to continue providing better infrastructure for future generations.

candidates.name: Lou Brown
candidates.why_elect: I currently represent the Te Awamutu RSA on senior Council and feel that with my experience and local knowledge I will be able to contribute more to an efficient and positive Council management.
candidates.why_stand: I currently represent the Te Awamutu RSA on Senior council and feel that with my experience and local knowledge I will be able to contribute more to an efficient and positive council management.

candidates.name: Michael Emery
candidates.why_elect: My leadership, science, and technology skills are exactly what is needed to move Waipa closer to the vision of a strong, vibrant and sought-after district. My experience of other cities and human geography training, bring a fresh perspective essential to modernising our district and instilling a renewed sense of purpose.
candidates.why_stand: I believe in the limitless potential of the Waipa District and in our ability to propel this region forward. That progress depends on economic and technological innovation, our environment, quality of life, and a more personal sense of community. I am running to set these conditions for success.

candidates.name: Bernhard Fynn
candidates.why_elect: I have a varied background, Prison Officer, motor mechanic, competitive swimmer and swim teacher/coach, 1st dan in Judo and started a judo club in Te Awamutu. Being retired and have the time rate payers concerns. I have lived in Wapa most of my life, Cambridge from 1950 and Te Awamutu from 1989.
candidates.why_stand: The rapid rise in the population has compromised the quality of life in Waipa. We have water restrictions in summer ,roads congested and in need or repair.I want to see our rates money spent on NEED not wants.

candidates.name: Bill Izard
candidates.why_elect: I've been involved in community and service organisations for years locally, from helping the elderly to organizing events for the town. I've owned and operated large multinational companies employing hundreds of people all over the world. I've been involved in business enterprise boards attracting companies into regions.
candidates.why_stand: I have the time and experience to give Te Awamutu-Kihikihi as a councillor. I have lived in the area for many years even married a local girl 38 year married. Being available full time as councillor. Connecting community with council representing the residents with regular meetings.

candidates.name: James Charles Morris Parlane
candidates.why_elect: Because I am able to look at things objectively and review the need for them. I can also question councils traditions and find more efficient ways to operate. There are too many cozy arrangements and the public need to be informed of them.
candidates.why_stand: Because the current council have madness when it comes to borrowing and spending. It is wasteful and has spent too much on "nice to haves" Te Awamutu is not the best place I would like to stop the rot and make it a bit better by making it affordable.

candidates.name: Dennis Pennefather
candidates.why_elect: I have lived in this community for ten years and worked with persons of special needs for most of that period. A background of 25 years as a policeman gave me a sense of humanity and kinship. I have skills which I wish to use to benefit the populace.
candidates.why_stand: I love the friendliness of the district and its people. I see some problems between council and its constituents and I would like to help solve those issues using skills I have obtained over years of police service and on community disability trusts.

candidates.name: Cassidy Temese
candidates.why_elect: I have extensive governance and advocacy experience, with strong established relationships with communities of the Waipā. A young, confident and articulate descendant of the many iwi and hapū of the Waipā, I have the passion and conviction to lead positive transformational change for all.
candidates.why_stand: The Waipā is my ancestral Tūrangawaewae. I have a deep responsibility to ensure that Waipā and the people who call it home are protected and nurtured for future generations to come.
